title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.1. DEMAND FOR YOUTH ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: By end 2021, young persons and adolescents are aware of their rights and are empowered to influence development policy decisions, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Economic And Social Policy General, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: By the end of 2022, the Government makes better use of knowledge about the situation of children, especially the most disadvantaged, in decision-making and implements inclusive development policies and strategies with youth and adolescents' participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, young persons and adolescents are aware of their rights and are empowered to influence development policy decisions

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the development and validation of the five-year National Youth Policy in February 2021, including a focus on youth engagement and participation. Youth engagement in 2021 also contributed substantially to the improvement of KRCs on registration of 0–5-year-olds, zero open defecation and quality of education in the localities of Mao, Moussoro, Bokoro and Mongo. UNICEF also engaged young people on climate change issues, through the participation of 10 young girls and boys in the Young Voices of the Sahel Initiative, together with youth from 10 other Sahel countries.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
